That's an interesting idea. I think it's possible that hell could be a metaphor for spiritual suffering or separation from a higher power. In fact, I've been reading about how some religious traditions view hell as a state of being disconnected from God or the divine, rather than a physical place. This perspective makes sense to me, as it emphasizes the importance of spiritual growth and connection with something greater than ourselves.

Growing up, I was taught that hell was a literal place, but now I'm not so sure. The idea that hell could be a metaphor for spiritual suffering or separation from a higher power resonates with me. It makes me think about my own spiritual journey and how I can cultivate a deeper connection with the divine.
